body:
Hi, I have updated a misconception about the functionality of batch normalization as it was presented in the `batch-norm.md`. I've also added the equivalent references for further information if the reader would like to go into more details about the particular topic and misconception.

Thanks!

title: Corrections and amendments to the Math Appendix
body:
I noticed some formula errors, incorrect terminology and some unnatural sounding language in the mathematics appendix likely due to the translation. I went through and corrected the errors and did some slight rewording of the language.

I'm not sure if you're looking for pull requests, but if it helps you can take a look at this diff at least for the mathematical errors.

- Updated incorrect formulas and terminology
- Correct some latex errors
- Translated non-English phrases
- Rewording some unnatural-sounding expressions

I build this chapter with $ python build/md2ipynb.py chapter_appendix/math.md ~/tmp/math.ipynb to verify it build correctly without error, and opened the notebook to verify it looked good in Jupyter.

title: Minor appendix corrections.
body:
- Use $n$th instead of $n$-th to be consistent with rest of the book.
- Correct language in notation section.
- Revert \textit.

title: Fix some typos in deep-learning-intro.md
body:
Since the diff does not easily show the changes in some cases, here is what I changed:

In the first hunk, I corrected Turing's name (from Allan to Alan).
In the one starting with "Attention mechanisms" I replaced "and" with "an" in "rather than having to remember and entire sentence". 
In the third big hunk I removed an "of" from "plenty of of (state, action, reward) triples"
In the last big hunk I removed a "solving" from "Rather than solving solving parametric approximations"

Fixed the reference to Turing's paper in the references section.
Also added some empty lines so that the first bullet point in a list is rendered properly.

- typo: "need iterate" -> "need to iterate"
- texts: "To generate the training set" -> "To evaluate the trained model"
- label notation in comments of mini-batch training scripts: "Y" -> "y"
- redundant spaces
- apostrophes: â€™ -> '

title: styling
body:
unless "whinges" is an element of styling, i substituted it for comment, as a comment does sound so much better than complaint.
If you take this edit as a whinge, i.e. fretfull complaint, feel free to disregard.
source: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/whinge

title: Typo fixes and punctuation recommendation
body: Additionally, changed 'plagiarising[sic]' to 'leveraging'.  The connotation of plagiarism is to take someone's work and claim it is your own.  While leveraging is to use something existing to maximum advantage.  I believe this is the intent of the sentence.

title: fix momenta url
body: Changed momenta URL from www.momenta.com to www.momenta.ai. The former is a leading designer while the later is an autonomous driving company.
